overview: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [1] It appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [1] The following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient to accomplish the purposes and programs designated herein, are appropriated or authorized from the sources of funding specified to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1]
appropriations: This Act appropriates sums to accomplish the purposes and programs designated to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] The bill appropriates $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in general obligation bond funds for investment capital under JUD601 - Administration for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1] The sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the projects listed in the Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The sums appropriated are designated for the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year of the fiscal biennium shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. [1] The appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [1]
agency_impact: Whenever the need arises, the chief justice, in administering an equitable and expeditious judicial process, may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes. [1] The judiciary may delegate to other state or county agencies the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project when it is determined by the judiciary to be advantageous to do so. [1] The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. [1]
economic_impact: This Act appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [1] If the chief justice, or any agency or government unit, secures federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act, they may enter into the undertaking. [1] The chief justice, or the agency or government unit with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. [1]
policy_impact: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [1] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes, provided no transfer shall be made to implement any collective bargaining contract signed after this legislature adjourns sine die. [1] If the amount allocated from the general obligation bond fund for a capital improvement project is insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the judiciary project adjustment fund. [1]
revenue_sources: The sources from which funds are appropriated are referred to as "Means of Financing," or "MOF". [1] The letter symbols for funding sources are A for General funds, B for Special funds, C for General obligation bond funds, N for Federal funds, and W for Revolving funds. [1] General obligation bonds may be issued to yield the amount necessary to finance authorized projects, provided that the sum total of the bonds so issued shall not exceed $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [1] For JUD101 - Courts of Appeal, the operating appropriation from general funds is $9,592,659 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2025-2026 and $9,657,093 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2026-2027. [1] For JUD310 – First Circuit, the general fund operating appropriations are $98,130,866 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $98,298,808 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [1] This circuit also has special fund appropriations of $4,261,273 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for each fiscal year. [1] For JUD320 – Second Circuit, the general fund operating appropriation is $20,150,130 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for each fiscal year. [1] The general fund operating appropriation for JUD330 – Third Circuit is $24,912,104 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2025-2026 and $24,903,209 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2026-2027. [1] Under JUD601 - Administration, the bill authorizes investment capital of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026 from general obligation bond funds. [1] The appropriations made for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [1] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The chief justice, or any agency or government unit, may secure federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act. [1] With the chief justice's approval, the agency or government unit may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. [1] The judiciary may also transfer savings from its general fund appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for capital improvement projects for FY 2025-2026. [1] The projects, with funding amounts listed in thousands of dollars in the Act, include $4,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for plans and design for a new South Kohala Judiciary Complex, $900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for A/C systems replacement at Pu‘uhonua Kaulike, and $5,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for lump sum CIP for judiciary facilities statewide. [1] [1] [1] [1] General obligation bonds may be issued to finance these projects, provided that the sum total so issued shall not exceed $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [1] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [1] All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives for capital improvements program purposes have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison.
